page.title: 09Leisure in Stratton
page.content: Social activities in Stratton in 1985 generally included people from surrounding districts. The pub welcomes chiildren in a separate room from the bar. Wessex Morris dancers give occasional exhibitions there. The Home and Garden Club has 80 members, who hold monthly meetings in the village hall. Mother and Toddler Group meets there, though obnly sporadically,depending on the birthrate. St. Mary's Wives Group hold monthly meetings, usually at a member's home. The Church Wewing Guild do likewise, to make kneelers for the church. Members from Stratton join Bradford Peverell Women's Institute.Church activities include clubs for children. A mobile library calls fortnightly. Occasional jumble sales and coffee mornings boost funds for various activities.
